alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Randolph and southeastern Cleburne Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Corinth, or 11 miles north of Lake Wedowee, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ranburne, Morrison Cross Roads, Fosters Cross Roads, Corinth, Abernathy, Trickem, Graham, Hollis Crossroads, Newell, Micaville and Camp Sequoyah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
